fx_impact.additional_info: FX decreased total company revenue growth by approximately 2 points, impacting Productivity and Business Processes and Intelligent Cloud by 2 points each, and More Personal Computing by 1 point. Additionally, FX decreased COGS growth by 1 point and operating expense growth by 2 points.

Productivity_and_Business_Processes.context: Includes Office Commercial, Office Consumer, Dynamics 365, and LinkedIn

drivers: Continued momentum in Microsoft 365 consumer subscriptions

Dynamics_365.context: Driven by Dynamics 365, which grew 25% YoY and +29% in constant currency

LinkedIn.context: Driven by growth in Talent Solutions
drivers: Weakness in Marketing Solutions due to advertising trends

Intelligent_Cloud.context: Includes Azure, Server Products, Enterprise Services, and GitHub

drivers: Expansion of hybrid and multi-cloud solutions
Customer migrations of critical workloads to Azure
Hybrid demand including better-than-expected annuity purchasing ahead of SQL Server 2022 launch
Better-than-expected performance across Enterprise Support Services and Microsoft Consulting Services

GitHub.context: Home to 100 million developers, continued growth post-acquisition
GitHub.impact: Enhanced developer tools and services contributing to Intelligent Cloud growth

More_Personal_Computing.context: Includes Windows OEM, Windows Commercial Products and Cloud Services, Gaming, Surface, and Search

Windows_OEM.context: Strength in the commercial PC market with higher revenue per license
drivers: Continued strength in the commercial PC market
Low impact from Windows 11 revenue deferral ($210 million shifted from Q1 to Q2)
Higher mix of contracts with higher in-period revenue recognition
Growth in Xbox Game Pass subscriptions
High prior year comparable benefited from increased console supply
Better-than-expected monetization in third-party and first-party content

Surface.context: Driven by commercial sales, partially offset by consumer weakness
drivers: Strong demand environment in commercial segment
Share gains for Edge browser globally and Bing in the U.S.

total_expenses.context: Operating expenses including investments in cloud engineering, Nuance, Xandr acquisitions, and commercial sales
key_factors: Integration of Nuance and Xandr acquisitions

COGS.context: Cost of Goods Sold including cloud infrastructure and services
COGS.guidance: Expected between $15.65 and $15.85 billion for Q3 2023

operating_income.context: Operating income including the impact of accounting estimate changes

net_income.context: Not explicitly detailed in the transcript

eps.context: Earnings Per Share, adjusted for the change in accounting estimate

context: Reflects the impact of accounting changes and acquisitions
Includes tax payments related to TCJA transition and intangible property transfers

free_cash_flow.context: Generated from operating activities after capital expenditures

capital_expenditures.context: Including finance leases, driven by ongoing investment to meet growing demand for cloud services and data center expansions

cash_paid_PP&E.context: Cash paid for Property, Plant, and Equipment

share_repurchase.context: Returned to shareholders through share repurchases and dividends

dividends.context: Part of the total capital return

Microsoft_Cloud.description: End-to-end platforms and tools for digital transformation
initiatives: Azure OpenAI Service with ChatGPT and GPT-4 integration
Expansion to 5G network edge with Azure for Operators
Azure Arc customer base growing to over 15,000
Azure powering OpenAI API for brands like Shopify and Snap
Record migrations, including Unilever's large-scale Azure migration
goals: Support AI-powered applications across cloud and edge
Enhance AI infrastructure to meet growing demand
Drive adoption of hybrid and multi-cloud solutions
examples: Epic Systems integrating AI with EHR software using Azure OpenAI Service
Unilever executing one of the largest-ever cloud migrations in consumer goods
AT&T, Deutsche Telekom, Singtel, and Telefonica modernizing networks with Azure

Data_and_AI.description: Leveraging data and AI for analytical and predictive power
initiatives: Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform enhancements
Azure OpenAI Service advancements
Integration of ChatGPT and GPT-4 into enterprise applications
Expansion of AI-powered features in business applications
goals: Enable organizations to maximize value from their data
Facilitate seamless AI integration across business functions
Enhance predictive and automation capabilities with AI
examples: NBA using Cosmos DB for real-time data ingestion and gameplay optimization
Mercedes-Benz leveraging Cosmos DB for ChatGPT service scalability
Coursera and Grammarly integrating AI into their platforms

Developer_Tools.description: Comprehensive toolchain for developers across platforms
initiatives: GitHub reaching 100 million developers
GitHub Copilot adoption by over 10,000 organizations
Expansion of AI capabilities in Visual Studio and Azure PaaS services
goals: Enhance developer productivity with AI tools
Support seamless transition from development to cloud deployment
Improve security and efficiency in software development workflows
examples: Coca-Cola and GM using GitHub Copilot to accelerate development
Duolingo and Mercado Libre increasing developer speed with Copilot
Toyota North America utilizing GitHub Advanced Security

Power_Platform.description: Empowering users with low-code/no-code tools for productivity
initiatives: AI-powered capabilities in Power Automate and Power Apps
Expansion of AI-driven features like Copilot in Power Apps
Integration of natural language processing to automate workflows
goals: Enable rapid app and workflow creation through AI
Facilitate business process automation with low-code solutions
Increase user engagement and productivity with Power Platform
examples: Coca-Cola and GM leveraging Power Automate to streamline operations
Integration of Copilot in Power Apps allowing conversational interactions
Rabobank using Power Automate to automate business processes

Dynamics_365.description: Accelerating digital transformation across business operations
initiatives: Dynamics 365 Copilot integration across CRM and ERP systems
AI-powered business applications to automate and predict business functions
Expansion of Dynamics 365 with new AI-driven features
goals: Enhance employee productivity with AI assistance
Automate manual tasks to improve efficiency
Provide predictive insights to drive business decisions
examples: Asahi, C.H. Robinson, E.ON, Franklin Templeton using Dynamics 365 Copilot
G&J Pepsi-Cola Bottlers automating field service with Dynamics 365
Siemens using Teams integrated with Azure OpenAI Service to optimize workflows

LinkedIn.description: Creating economic opportunity for every global workforce member
initiatives: Record engagement with over 930 million members
Expansion in India with 100 million members
Introduction of AI-powered features like writing suggestions and collaborative articles
Launch of AI-powered courses and certifications through EduBrite
goals: Increase member engagement and platform usage
Enhance talent acquisition with AI-driven tools
Support skill-building and professional development with AI features
examples: Gen Z student sign-ups increased by 73% YoY
Netflix launching ad-supported subscription powered by Microsoft
PromoteIQ enabling retailers like Hudson’s Bay to build digital commerce channels

initiatives: Introduction of Microsoft 365 Copilot and Business Chat
Expansion of Teams usage to over 300 million monthly active users
Launch of Teams Premium with AI-powered features
Integration of Viva with LinkedIn’s Glint employee engagement tool
Deployment of Teams Rooms to 5,000 meeting rooms globally
goals: Enhance collaboration and productivity with AI tools
Expand Teams capabilities for hybrid work environments
Support employee experience and engagement with Viva
examples: ABN AMRO, Jaguar Land Rover, Mattress Firm, Unisys, and Vodafone adopting Teams
Novo Nordisk deploying Teams Rooms to 5,000 meeting rooms
US Bank using Viva to streamline employee communications
Carlsberg using Viva to centralize digital employee experience for 29,000 employees

Windows_and_Bing_Edge.description: Operating systems and search engine enhancements
initiatives: Deployment of Windows 365 Frontline for shift workers
Integration of Xandr acquisition into advertising solutions
Expansion of Bing and Edge with AI-powered features like Dall-E
Partnership with Netflix for ad-supported subscription
Continuous share gains for Edge browser and Bing in the U.S.
goals: Enhance user experience on Windows, Bing, and Edge with AI
Expand advertising capabilities with AI-driven platforms
Increase market share for Bing and Edge browsers
examples: Bing reaching over 100 million daily active users
Edge taking share for the eighth consecutive quarter
Netflix launching ad-supported subscription powered by Microsoft
Over 200 million images created using Dall-E on Bing and Edge

Security.description: Comprehensive Zero Trust architecture and advanced security solutions
initiatives: Introduction of Security Copilot combining LLMs with domain-specific models
Expansion of governance controls and policy protections
Integration of Entra for permissions management and identity governance
Enhancements to Microsoft Defender for DevOps lifecycle security
goals: Transform SOC productivity with AI-driven tools
Enhance identity and access management
Protect digital estates across all cloud and endpoint platforms
examples: EY and Qualcomm choosing full security stack for protection and visibility
Bridgewater Associates using Microsoft Security Experts
Roku adopting integrated XDR and SIEM capabilities with Microsoft Sentinel

Gaming.description: Expanding and innovating gaming services and platforms
initiatives: Growth in Xbox Game Pass subscriptions and monthly active users
Expansion of Xbox Cloud Gaming to 40 new countries
Partnerships with Riot Games for PC and mobile games
Upcoming AAA game launches like Minecraft Legends and Redfall
goals: Increase user engagement and monetization through Game Pass
Expand game distribution and play experiences globally
Enhance gaming ecosystem with cloud and metaverse platforms
examples: Game Pass subscriptions reaching nearly $1 billion
Surpassing 500 million lifetime unique users across first-party titles
Launching PC Game Pass in 40 new countries
Exciting new titles from ZeniMax and Xbox Game Studios announced

revenue_growth.expectation: Healthy revenue growth driven by AI platform, differentiated solutions, and consistent execution across Microsoft Cloud
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Another strong quarter of revenue growth
factors: Growth in Azure consumption and long-term contracts
revenue_growth.specifics: Commercial bookings growth should be healthy but impacted by strong prior year comparable and low growth in expiry base

drivers: Continued investment in strategic and high growth areas in H2

expense_outlook_excluding_accrual.note: Expense outlook essentially unchanged excluding GitHub-related expenses

core_trends: Continued investment in cloud and AI
Strategic acquisitions to enhance product offerings

capital_expenditures_guidance.context: Expected to increase sequentially in Q4 as investments continue to meet growing customer demand

context: Reflects the impact of accounting changes and acquisitions
Includes tax payments related to TCJA transition and intangible property transfers

drivers: Continued investment in strategic and high growth areas in H2

capital_expenditures.guidance: Expected to increase sequentially in Q4

operating_environment_challenges: Managing currency fluctuations impacting revenue and expenses
Deteriorating PC market affecting Windows OEM and Surface sales
Reductions in advertising spend impacting LinkedIn and Search advertising
Integration of Nuance and Xandr acquisitions
Higher energy costs impacting Azure margins
Supply chain constraints affecting device shipments
Macro-economic uncertainty leading to cautious customer spend
Operational challenges in new product launches
